definition: Gu Yanwu (1613-1682), late Ming and early Qing Confucian philosopher, linguist and historian, played a founding role in phonology of early Chinese, author of Rizhilu or Record of daily study 日知錄|日知录
surname Gu
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to
flame/inflammation/-itis
surname Wu
martial/military

sentences.english: Gu has proposed a series of methods for cultivating the virtue of shame.
sentences.chinese: 顾炎武还提出了一系列培养“耻德”的方法。

sentences.english: His view of shame is of great value for the construction of the contemporary concepts of honor and disgrace.
sentences.chinese: 顾炎武的“耻德”观对当代荣辱观建设具有启示意义。

sentences.english: Thinking much of customs and education was stress of the Guyanwu's etiquette research.
sentences.chinese: 重视风俗教化是顾炎武礼学研究的重点。

definition: Huang Zongxi (1610-1695), scholar and writer of the Ming-Qing transition
Wang Fuzhi (1619-1692), wide-ranging scholar of the Ming-Qing transition
Zhang Pu (1602-1641), Ming dynasty scholar and prolific writer, proponent of 複社|复社[fu4 she4] cultural renewal movement, author of Five tombstone inscriptions 五人墓碑記|五人墓碑记[wu3 ren2 mu4 bei1 ji4]
Li Zhi (1527-1602), late Ming philosopher, historian and writer
Gong Zizhen (1792-1841), Chinese man of letters, calligrapher and poet
Hong Liangji (1746-1809), poet and historian
Zhu Xi or Chu Hsi (1130-1200), also known as Master Zhu 朱子, Song dynasty Confucian writer and propagandist, founder of neo-Confucianism
Zhao Yi (1727-1814), Qing dynasty poet and historian, one of Three great poets of the Qianlong era 乾嘉三大家
Yuan Hongdao (1568-1610), Ming dynasty poet and travel writer
Dai Mingshi (1653-1713), early Qing writer
Zhang Taiyan (1869-1936), scholar, journalist, revolutionary and leading intellectual around the time of the Xinhai revolution
Xue Fucheng (1838-1894), Qing official and progressive political theorist
Zhang Dai (1597-c. 1684), late Ming scholar
Xu Guangqi (1562-1633), agricultural scientist, astronomer, and mathematician in the Ming dynasty
Wang Shizhen (1634-1711), early Qing poet
Rizhilu or Record of daily study, by early Confucian philosopher Gu Yanwu 顧炎武|顾炎武
